data.title: Miss USA Winners List From 1951 To 2023
data.meta_description: The American beauty pageant winners have made a breathtaking appearance every year. Let’s take a look at the Miss USA winners.
data.text:
The American beauty pageant winners have made a breathtaking appearance every year. The Miss USA winners list is pretty massive. The beauty pageant has been held annually since 1952. The Miss USA pageant has been celebrating beauty and personality for a while now. Over the years, multiple talented women from different backgrounds and states have claimed the crown of Miss USA.

Each year, the contestants from multiple states come together to represent their state in the beauty pageant. Beyond just a title, Miss USA offers a platform for women to talk about important issues. Whether it’s raising awareness about mental health or promoting education, there’s a positive change.

Complete List Of Miss USA Winners

Your wait is over! We have compiled a comprehensive list of Miss USA winners by state, age, and year. The journey of becoming Miss USA is not just about beauty but also confidence, compassion, intelligence, leadership, and more.

Miss USA Winners Diversification Explored

The winners of Miss USA come from different backgrounds and have left a legacy behind.

R’Bonney Gabriel crowned in 2022 is the oldest Miss USA pageant winner. At the time of crowning, she was around 28 years old.

Olivia Jordan crowned in 2015 is the only Miss USA winner that competed in both famous international beauty pageants Miss Universe and Miss World.

Macel Wilson crowned in 1962, became the first-ever Asian-American woman to win Miss USA.

Carole Gist crowned in 1990 is the first-ever African-American woman to win Miss USA.

Every year, the states choose the woman representing them in the annual state pageant season. Some states also have their local beauty pageant competition to determine the delegates for the state pageant.

Texas has the most wins with 10 women crowned Miss USA followed by California with 10 wins. The contestants are judged based on multiple rounds like evening gown, swimsuit, and interview. For around the first 8 years from 1952–1959, Miss USA was held in Long Beach, California. Now the pageant is held in multiple locations.

Conclusion

Miss USA stands as a symbol of excellence and empowerment. The Miss USA winners have left a lasting impression with their beauty and personality. Even the contestants who didn’t win the title are remembered by the audience and their state. Women from every corner of the USA have displayed different personalities and will be cherished. What are your thoughts on Miss USA winners? You’re welcome to talk about your favourite contestants in the comment box below.

FAQs

1. Who Won The Most Miss USA?

Texas has won the most Miss USA title with 10 wins followed by California with 6 wins and New York and Hawaii with 4 wins each.

2. Who Was The First Miss USA Winner?

The first-ever Miss USA winner was Jackie Loughery representing New York in 1952.

3. How Many Miss USA Won Miss Universe?

USA witnessed a total of nine wins in Miss Universe and has the highest number of victories. The first winner was Miriam Jacqueline Stevenson in 1954.

4. How Many Times USA Won Miss World?

USA won Miss World around three times in 1973, 1990, and 2010.
